title: Drawing, 1840–60
medium: Brush and white gouache, blue and green watercolor; graphite; pen and brown ink on heavy cream wove paper
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of Mary Hearn Greims
description: Project for the painted decoration of a wall. The blue panel shows a complicated white lozenge decoration, composed of floral elements, and having free spaces of vertical or horizontal extensions in alternate rows. An arabesque motif fills these, resulting in a reciprocal ornamentation. At top are three dark olive stripes upon blue.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, 1840–60.
1840–60. Brush and white gouache, blue and green watercolor; graphite; pen and brown ink on heavy cream wove paper. Museum purchase through gift of Mary Hearn Greims. 1940-120-20.
